Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it only includes two images of a damaged road and a nearby group of people, without providing any additional evidence or context.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the destruction of the road is directly linked to the #EndSARS protests in Nigeria, without considering alternative explanations or factors that may have contributed to the damage.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim fails to consider alternative explanations for the destruction of the road, such as the incident actually occurring in South Africa due to local grievances related to access to water and electricity.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the images of the damaged road are actually from South Africa, not Nigeria, as confirmed by the provincial transport department and verified through Google Maps Street View.
Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent of the destruction caused by the #EndSARS protesters, as it only provides images of a single damaged road without any evidence of widespread destruction of highways in Nigeria.
Understate: The claim may understate the overall impact of the #EndSARS protests in Nigeria by focusing on a single instance of road damage, without acknowledging the broader context of the protests and their consequences.
